page.title: 03Buxhall - Farming: Cereals
page.content: Cereals are the area's most important crop, with{winter wheat}forming the principle variety. Wheat is grown for animal feed, export or milling depending on quality. All these out- lets are available in Suffolk with a few feed and flour mills, and export facilities at several East Anglian ports. The heavy soil tends to ensure good quality wheat with high yields hence the popularity of the crop. One farmer produces wheat for seed which is sold to a local merchant for dressing and resale. {Barley}is mainly autumn sown for animal feed but a significant amount is sold locally for malting providing the quality is satisfactory. Most grain is stored on the farm if not sold at harvest. Extra production over recent years has resulted in many new stores being erected.
